input: Long COVID continues to puzzle healthcare experts worldwide, as thousands report persistent symptoms weeks to months after recovering from the initial infection. Common long-lasting symptoms include fatigue, shortness of breath, cognitive disturbances, and fluctuating heart rates. This phenomenon is not only a medical challenge but also impacts the daily lives of sufferers. Recent studies emphasize the importance of a holistic approach to managing these symptoms, including both medical interventions and lifestyle adjustments. Experts suggest that gradual increase in physical activity, mindfulness exercises, and dietary changes can play a crucial role in coping with long COVID. However, they caution against overexertion, as it can exacerbate symptoms.
